intro: Nyssa oye-chee, commonly known as the Florida ash, is a deciduous tree native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Cornaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that turn yellow in the fall. The tree produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters, followed by dark blue berries that are edible for some bird species. Its bark is smooth and gray, often peeling in thin layers, and it can grow up to 30 meters tall in suitable conditions. Nyssa oye-chee plays an important ecological role in its native habitats, providing food and shelter for various wildlife.
